messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

Prod rollout is still aligned with the 30 Nov launch.\n\nFor ClientCo, you can safely say: \"staging access expected mid next week, production by end of the month\" as long as we don‚Äôt hit any last‚Äëminute blockers.",

Engineering is targeting code-complete by **Mon 24 Nov**, with a staging deployment expected on **25‚Äì26 Nov**, assuming no major issues.\n\nProduction rollout is still aligned with the overall Website Redesign launch date of **30 Nov**.\n\nShared this ETA with ClientCo.",

Engineering is currently working on it, and we‚Äôre targeting code-complete by **Mon 24 Nov**.\n\nAssuming everything goes to plan, you should see it available in your **staging environment around 25‚Äì26 Nov**, with production rollout aligned to our broader Website Redesign launch on **30 Nov**.\n\nIf anything changes, we‚Äôll update you via this thread.\n\nBest,\nSam\nSenior Support Engineer\ncompany.com",

      "type": "weekly_report",
      "abstract_description": "PM summarizes weekly wins such as performance improvements and user growth.",
      "metrics_hint": {
        "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
        "users_growth_percent": 10
      },
      "expanded_events": [
        {

          "metrics": {
            "page_load_p75_ms_before": 2100,
            "page_load_p75_ms_after": 1785,
            "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
            "weekly_active_users_before": 20000,
            "weekly_active_users_after": 22000,
            "users_growth_percent": 10
          },

        },
        {
          "channel": "slack",
          "id": "slack_data_request_1",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T09:17:29+00:00",
          "sender": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "participants": [
            "alex.smith@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "channel_name": "eng-web-redesign",
          "type": "message",
          "text": "Taylor, for my weekly report I want to call out concrete wins from the WEB work. From the perf dashboard I‚Äôm seeing roughly a 15% improvement on p75 page load and about 10% lift in weekly active users on the redesigned pages. Does that line up with what you‚Äôre seeing?",
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_data_request_1_reply_1",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-21T09:23:02+00:00",
              "sender": "taylor.brown@company.com",
              "type": "message",
              "text": "Yep, that matches our internal graphs. We shaved ~300ms off the core flow and traffic to the new experience is ramping nicely. You can safely quote ~15% perf improvement and ~10% user growth in your summary."
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "channel": "doc",
          "id": "doc_weekly_pm_notes_raw",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T10:02:44+00:00",
          "type": "document",
          "author": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "title": "WEB ‚Äì Weekly Notes (2025-11-21)",
          "project_key": "WEB",
          "content": "WEB ‚Äì Weekly Notes (internal scratch)\n\nHighlights:\n- Performance: p75 page load on redesigned pages improved by ~15% week-over-week.\n- Growth: ~10% increase in weekly active users interacting with the new flows vs last week.\n- Stability: no major incidents tied to WEB rollout.\n\nTo weave into weekly email as \"wins\" section.",
          "shared_with": [
            "alex.smith@company.com"
          ]
        },
        {
          "channel": "email",
          "id": "email_weekly_report_to_executives",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T15:31:57+00:00",
          "sender": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "recipients": [
            "product-lead@company.com",
            "eng-lead@company.com"
          ],
          "cc": [
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Weekly Product Update ‚Äì WEB (w/e 21 Nov)",
          "body": "Hi all,\n\nSharing a quick WEB project update for the week ending 21 Nov.\n\nKey wins\n- **Performance improvements**: On the redesigned website pages, p75 page load times improved by roughly **15%** week-over-week. This is primarily due to the asset bundling and image optimization work that went live on Monday.\n- **User growth**: We‚Äôre seeing around **10% growth** in weekly active users interacting with the new flows compared to last week, as traffic continues to ramp to the redesigned experience.\n- **Stability**: No major incidents attributed to the WEB changes this week.\n\nLooking ahead\n- Finalize WEB-101 (core feature) for code-complete next week and prepare for the 30 Nov launch.\n\nBest,\nAlex\nPM ‚Äì Website Redesign",
          "attachments": [],
          "related_documents": [
            "doc_weekly_pm_notes_raw"
          ]
        },
        {
          "channel": "slack",
          "id": "slack_weekly_report_followup",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-21T16:02:21+00:00",
          "sender": "eng-lead@company.com",
          "participants": [
            "eng-lead@company.com",
            "alex.smith@company.com",
            "taylor.brown@company.com"
          ],
          "channel_name": "leadership",
          "type": "message",
          "text": "Nice numbers on WEB this week. The 15% perf bump + ~10% user lift are good proof points for the redesign work.",
          "replies": [
            {
              "id": "slack_weekly_report_followup_reply_1",
              "timestamp": "2025-11-21T16:05:17+00:00",
              "sender": "alex.smith@company.com",

              "text": "Thanks ‚Äì I‚Äôll continue tracking those metrics as we move toward the 30 Nov launch."
